question: What was the global carbon dioxide emissions from fossil fuels and industry in 2023, measured in gigatons of CO2?
source_text: Global Carbon Project tracks annual CO2 emissions; 2023 saw approximately 37.5 Gt CO2 from all fossil fuels and industrial processes.

question: How many billion people worldwide lack access to electricity as of 2023?
source_text: International Energy Agency estimates approximately 710 million people lack access to electricity, concentrated in Sub-Saharan Africa and parts of Asia.

question: What percentage of the world's renewable electricity generation came from solar power in 2023?
source_text: IEA Renewables 2023 report indicated solar accounted for approximately 16% of global renewable electricity generation.

question: How many million metric tons of food waste is generated annually in the European Union?
source_text: Eurostat and EU reports estimate approximately 92 million metric tons of food waste annually across the EU-27.

question: What is the maternal mortality ratio (deaths per 100,000 live births) in Sub-Saharan Africa as of 2020?
source_text: WHO World Health Statistics 2022 reported Sub-Saharan Africa's maternal mortality ratio at approximately 376 per 100,000 live births.

question: How many million kilometers of roads are paved globally as of 2023?
source_text: World Bank Infrastructure reports estimate approximately 20 million kilometers of paved roads exist globally.

question: What is the global share of gdp spent on research and development in 2022?
source_text: OECD Science, Technology and R&D Statistics report global R&D expenditure at approximately 1.9% of world GDP in 2022.

question: How many billion chickens are raised for meat globally in any given year as of 2023?
source_text: FAO FAOSTAT data indicates approximately 28 billion chickens are raised annually for meat production worldwide.

question: What percentage of global internet users access the internet primarily via mobile devices as of 2024?
source_text: Statista and ITU data show approximately 67% of global internet users primarily access the internet via smartphones and mobile devices.

question: How many million hectares of forest are lost annually due to deforestation as of 2022?
source_text: FAO Forest Resources Assessment 2020 reported net forest loss of approximately 10.1 million hectares per year during 2015-2020.
